user_stories.title: As a Quantitative Analyst, I want to define strategy parameters so that I can capture the specific logic of my trading strategy.
user_stories.description: This story focuses on defining the individual parameters that constitute a trading strategy, such as entry/exit points, indicators, and allocation rules. These parameters should be flexible and extensible.
acceptance_criteria: The system can store various data types for strategy parameters (e.g., numeric, string, boolean, date/time).
A strategy can have multiple named parameters associated with it.
The system enforces basic data type validation for parameter values.
It's possible to add new parameter types without major code changes.

tasks.title: Design StrategyParameter data model
tasks.description: Define the schema for strategy parameters including name, type, and value.

tasks.title: Implement ORM for StrategyParameter
tasks.description: Create the Object-Relational Mapping for the StrategyParameter entity.

tasks.title: Develop API endpoint for adding parameters to a strategy
tasks.description: Create a REST endpoint to associate parameters with a given strategy ID.

tasks.title: Implement data validation for parameter types
tasks.description: Ensure that parameter values conform to their defined data types before persistence.

user_stories.title: As a Developer, I want to persist strategy definitions in a database so that they are reliably stored and retrieved.
user_stories.description: This story addresses the capability to save complete trading strategy definitions, including all their associated parameters, to a persistent storage and retrieve them when needed.
acceptance_criteria: A new trading strategy, including its parameters, can be successfully created and stored in the database.
An existing trading strategy can be retrieved from the database by its unique identifier.
Modifications to a strategy's parameters can be updated in the database.
Deletion of a strategy removes all associated parameters from the database.

tasks.title: Design Strategy model structure
tasks.description: Define the primary attributes of a trading strategy (e.g., name, description, creation date, status).

tasks.title: Implement database migrations for Strategy and StrategyParameter
tasks.description: Create SQL or ORM migrations to establish the necessary tables and relationships.

tasks.title: Develop API endpoints for CRUD operations on strategies
tasks.description: Implement create, read, update, and delete functionality for strategy entities.

tasks.title: Ensure transactional integrity for strategy persistence
tasks.description: Verify that strategy and its parameters are saved/updated atomically.

user_stories.title: As a Lead Developer, I want to ensure the strategy data model is scalable and performant so that it can support a large number of strategies and concurrent access.
user_stories.description: This story focuses on the technical considerations for the data model's performance and scalability, ensuring that as the number of strategies grows, the system remains responsive.
acceptance_criteria: Retrieval of a single strategy (with parameters) completes within acceptable latency (<100ms).
The database schema uses appropriate indexing for primary keys and foreign keys.
The database read/write operations can handle a specified load (e.g., 100 concurrent requests).
The chosen database technology is suitable for high-volume data persistence.

tasks.title: Review and optimize database schema for indexes
tasks.description: Add appropriate indexes to improve query performance for strategy and parameter tables.

tasks.title: Conduct performance testing for CRUD operations
tasks.description: Execute load tests on the strategy management API to identify bottlenecks.

tasks.title: Document database design decisions and rationale
tasks.description: Create documentation explaining the chosen database structure and why certain decisions were made.

tasks.title: Implement caching for frequently accessed strategies (if needed)
tasks.description: Investigate and implement a caching layer for strategies to reduce database load.
